Docs.summary: Provides access and information for manipulating data stores in a .

.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo CreateStream(string name) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteSubStorage (string name);
.method public hidebysig instance void DeleteSubStorage(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the sub-store to delete.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the specified sub-store itself contains child sub-stores, DeleteSubStorage also recursively deletes all descendant sub-stores.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo GetStreamInfo (string name);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo GetStreamInfo(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the instance to return.
Docs.summary: Returns the instance with the given name.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo[] GetStreams ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo[] GetStreams() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of the instances that are currently contained in this store.
Docs.returns: An array of the objects, each pointing to an I/O steam defined within this store.

remarks.format:
## Remarks GetStreams will always return a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo> array, but the array may be empty (zero-length) if there are no streams defined in the store.
GetStreams provides a snapshot of the streams currently defined in the store. The individual <xref:System.IO.Packaging.StreamInfo> objects will reflect the updated state of their respective streams, but the returned array will not be updated with any additions or deletions. Call GetStreams again to obtain an updated array as streams added or deleted to the store.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo GetSubStorageInfo (string name);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo GetSubStorageInfo(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the sub-store to return.
Docs.summary: Returns the child sub-store with a given name.
Docs.returns: The child sub-store with the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo[] GetSubStorages ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo[] GetSubStorages() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of the child sub-stores that are currently contained in this store.
Docs.returns: An array of objects, each pointing to a sub-store defined within this store.

remarks.format:
## Remarks GetSubStorages will always return a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo> array, but the array may be empty (zero-length) if there are no sub-stores.
GetSubStorages provides a snapshot of the sub-stores currently defined in this store. The individual <xref:System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo> objects will reflect the updated state of their respective stores, but the returned array will not be updated with any additions or deletions. Call GetSubStorages again to obtain an updated array as sub-stores added or deleted to the store.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Name { get; }
.property instance string Name

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name of a sub-store is specified to the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.StorageInfo.CreateSubStorage%2A> method and cannot be changed after created.
